snippet: Pal Schmitt, the president of Hungary, resigned from his largely ceremonial post amid a storm of criticism over what he called “unfounded allegations” of plagiarism in his 1992 doctoral thesis.
abstract: Hungarian Pres Pal Schmitt resigns after days of political turmoil over what he called 'unfounded allegations' of plagiarism in his 1992 doctoral thesis; university that awarded his degree stripped it from him a week earlier.
lead_paragraph: Pal Schmitt, the president of Hungary, resigned from his largely ceremonial post amid a storm of criticism over what he called “unfounded allegations” of plagiarism in his 1992 doctoral thesis.

headline.main: Hungarian President Resigns Amid Plagiarism Scandal
